results.definition: a flight of stairs or a flight of steps
the course along which a person has walked or is walking in
examples: I followed in his steps
he retraced his steps
his steps turned toward home

results.definition: any maneuver made as part of progress toward a goal
examples: the situation called for strong measures
the police took steps to reduce crime

results.definition: the distance covered by a step
examples: he stepped off ten paces from the old tree and began to dig

results.definition: the act of changing location by raising the foot and setting it down
examples: he walked with unsteady steps

results.definition: support consisting of a place to rest the foot while ascending or descending a stairway
examples: he paused on the bottom step

results.definition: relative position in a graded series
examples: always a step behind
subtle gradations in color
keep in step with the fashions

results.definition: a short distance
examples: it's only a step to the drugstore

results.definition: the sound of a step of someone walking
examples: he heard footsteps on the porch

results.definition: a musical interval of two semitones
a mark of a foot or shoe on a surface
examples: the police made casts of the footprints in the soft earth outside the window

results.definition: a solid block joined to the beams in which the heel of a ship's mast or capstan is fixed
a sequence of foot movements that make up a particular dance
examples: he taught them the waltz step

results.definition: shift or move by taking a step
examples: step back

results.definition: put down or press the foot, place the foot
examples: For fools rush in where angels fear to tread
step on the brake

results.definition: cause (a computer) to execute a single command
treat badly
examples: This boss abuses his workers
She is always stepping on others to get ahead

results.definition: furnish with steps
examples: The architect wants to step the terrace

results.definition: move with one's feet in a specific manner
examples: step lively

results.definition: walk a short distance to a specified place or in a specified manner
examples: step over to the blackboard

results.definition: place (a ship's mast) in its step
measure (distances) by pacing
examples: step off ten yards

results.definition: move or proceed as if by steps into a new situation
examples: She stepped into a life of luxury
he won't step into his father's footsteps
